alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Faulkner; Grant; Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 1:16PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong mid-level low pressure system has developed leaving a narrow corridor of strong winds near and behind the edge of departing precipitation moving east away from Central Arkansas. These winds will impact portions of Prairie, Lonoke, northeastern Grant, southeastern Faulkner, northwestern Monroe, northern Jefferson, southeastern Saline, Pulaski and northwestern Arkansas Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 109 PM CDT, surface observation stations and National Weather Service meteorologists observed strong winds of 25 to 30 mph, gusting to 40 mph or slightly higher at times across Pulaski County. Pulaski County officials have reported some small trees blown over roadways, likely due to the combination of extremely saturated soils and the strong winds of 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Several observations across Pulaski County IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Conway... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Stuttgart... Lonoke... Des Arc... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... North Little Rock Airport... Little Rock AFB... Southwest Little Rock... Ward... Vilonia... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 122 and 142. Interstate 40 between mile markers 127 and 204. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 27. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 14. US Highway 67 between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
